intro: Hyoscyamus pojarkovae, commonly known as the Pojarkov's henbane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, violet or purple flowers. The plant produces small, spherical berries that contain the toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
